meanings.definition: An early symptom indicating the onset of a disease or illness.
meanings.sent1: The sudden headache was a prodrome of the flu.
meanings.sent2: The fever was a prodrome of the upcoming illness.
meanings.sent3: The prodrome of a cold made me reach for the tissues.
meanings.sent4: Her fatigue was a prodrome of the busy week ahead.
meanings.sent5: The prodrome of a sore throat lingered for days.

meanings.definition: A warning sign or precursor to a more serious event.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were a prodrome of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The tremors were a prodrome of the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The prodrome of a bad day started with spilling coffee.
meanings.sent4: His silence was a prodrome of the impending argument.
meanings.sent5: The prodrome of trouble was evident in her worried expression.
